basics.name: Steven Caro
basics.label: Graduate Student
basics.summary: A German-born theoretical physicist, widely ranked among the greatest and most influential scientists of all time

courses: Supervised by Dr. Stephen L. Smith

work.name: Autonomous Systems Lab, Vector Institute & University of Waterloo
work.summary: Optimize policies for autonomous robots using PyTorch and state-of-the-art Machine Learning techniques. Coupling ML with Computer Vision to develop efficient manipulation policies for robotics.
highlights: reinforcement learning, pytorch, computer vision, robotics

work.name: Human Systems Lab, University of Windsor
work.summary: Used Python to create diagnostic tests used in conjuction with an eye-tracking device. Used The data accumulated from the eye-tracking device to generate a report that optometrists use to diagnose common optical diseases.

work.name: Pernod Ricard â€” Hiram Walker & Sons Ltd.
work.summary: Completed electrical designs for the installation of a fire safety system. Programmed PLCs using RSLogix 5000 and HMIs using FactoryTalk View Studio to increase the efficiency of the bottling process. Assisted in programming logic for quality assurance on bottling lines and defect detection using x-ray & computer vision.
highlights: PLC programming, FactoryTalk View Studio, AutoCAD Electrical

work.name: Onyx Engineering Inc.
work.summary: Implemented circuit design modifications using AutoCAD Electrical. Trained in SCADA & HMI Industrial Automation. Used Visual Basic, macros, and pivot tables to import and analyze daily website traffic data.

work.name: Entegrus Powerlines Inc.
work.summary: Performed load flow and voltage drop studies to determine acceptable transformer and conductor sizes for new residential developments. Assisted in creating and balancing the 2022 budget by performing cost-estimation on proposed projects, and prioritizzing the projects by metrics such as customer impact, safety, and reliability.

publications.name: Bench-NPIN: Benchmarking Non-prehensile Interactive Navigation
publications.summary: Bench-NPIN is a comprehensive benchmark for evaluating non-prehensile interactive navigation tasks. It provides simulated environments, evaluation metrics, and baseline demonstrations, and is available as an open-source Python library.

projects.name: Wearable Biomimetic Appendage
projects.summary: Undergraduate Capstone: A device that can mimic a user's hand and finger movements to aid in basic tasks.

volunteer.summary: Lead organizer for the New York City branch of the People's Climate March, the largest climate march in history.
highlights: Awarded 'Climate Hero' award by Greenpeace for my efforts organizing the march.
Men of the year 2014 by Time magazine

awards.title: NSERC CGSM Research Grant
awards.awarder: Natural Sciences and Engineering Research Council of Canada
awards.summary: Valued at $27,000. Awarded for outstanding academic performance and research potential.

awards.title: Engineering Excellence Master's Fellowship
awards.summary: Valued at $25,000/year. Selected amongst all master's applicants for the Faculty of Engineering.

awards.title: President's Entrance Award
awards.summary: Valued at $2,000/term. Received for > 95% average in senior year of high school.
